questions.question_text:
A company produces multiple products that require an installation kit that includes 50 components.
The company does not want to include these 50 components in every Bill of materials (BOM). You have a BOM kit that includes all 50 components, but you do not want it to produce a separate production order.
You need to set up the product BOM for the finished good.
What should you do?

choices.D: Change the line type to Pegged supply
choices.A: Select Phantom on the engineering fast tab on the kit item
choices.C: Change the line type to Phantom
choices.B: Change the coverage group on the kit item to Manual

discussion.content:
The given answer is wrong.
The correct sequence should be
1 - Select "Report as finished" in the "Process" section of the ribbon bar.
6 - Select "Default values" in the dialog that opens up.
5 - In the "Picking list journal" field group, select "Always" in "Automatic BOM consumption"
4 - Click "Make default for all users". You may have to click the 3 dots first, if it does not show.
